docs.summary: An element for sending and receiving chat messages.
description: The Wix Chat application lets you communicate with site visitors via a chatbox.
The chatbox sends messages over a chat channel, which connects 2 or more chat participants.
Site visitors can participate in the following chat scenarios:
+ Business Chat: Site members and visitors chat with the site owner or contributor, referred to as the "business."
+ Social Chat: Site members chat with other site members, privately or in a group chat.

docs.summary: Indicates if an element appears on all pages or only on the current page.
description: If `global` is `true`, the element appears on all pages.
If `global` is `false`, the element only appears on the current page.

examples.title: Get whether an element is displayed on all pages

docs.summary: Indicates if the chatbox is visible or hidden.
description: If `hidden` is `true`, the chatbox is not displayed on the page.
If `hidden` is `false`, the chatbox is displayed on the page.
To set the `hidden` property on the chatbox, use the chatbox's
[`hide()`](#hide) or [`show()`](#show) functions.
If you select **Hidden on load** in the chatbox's Properties panel
in the Editor, the `hidden` property is set to `true` when the page loads.

examples.title: Get the chatbox's hidden status
Toggle an element's hidden state

docs.summary: Indicates if the element is actually visible.
description: If `isVisible` is `true`, the element is displayed on the page.
If `isVisible` is `false`, the element is not displayed on the page.

examples.title: Get whether the chatbox is visible

docs.summary: Indicates if the chatbox is maximized.
description: If `maximized` is `true`, the chatbox is expanded. If `maximized` is `false`,
the chatbox is minimized.

examples.title: Get the chatbox's maximized status
Toggle a chatbox's maximized state

docs.summary: Note: This standard element property is not relevant for Chatbox.
description: Gets the element's parent element.
Some elements can contain other elements. This occurs when you drag
an element onto a container element. The container is the `parent` of
all the elements it contains.
[`Page`]($w.Page.html), [`Header`]($w.Header.html), and
[`Footer`]($w.Footer.html) are top-level elements and have no parent.

params.name: channelInfo
params.doc: Channel information specifying which channel to focus on.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the chat box focuses on the channel.

docs.summary: Expands the chatbox and focuses it on the specified chat channel.
description: The `focusChannel()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when
the chatbox focuses on the specified channel.
You can focus on a channel by specifying one of the following:
+ Channel ID: Focus on the channel with the specified ID. `type` is ignored.
+ Type: Focus on the channel of the specified type. Currently, only type `Business` is supported.

examples.title: Expand the chatbox and focus it on the channel with the specified ID
body: console.log("Done maximizing chatbox and focusing channel");

examples.title: Expand the chatbox and focus it on the business channel
body: console.log("Done maximizing chatbox and focusing channel");

params.name: channelInfo
params.doc: Channel information specifying which channel to get.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the information associated with the specific channel has been retrieved.

docs.summary: Gets a chatbox channel.
description: The `getChannel()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the requested channel.
You can get a channel by specifying one of the following:
+ Channel ID: Gets the channel with the specified ID. `type` is ignored.
+ Type: Gets the channel of the specified type:
+ "Focused": Gets the currently focused channel.
+ "Business": Gets the business channel.

examples.title: Get information about the channel associated with the specified channel ID
Get information about the currently focused chat channel

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the list of channels has been retrieved.

docs.summary: Gets a list of available chat channels for a site visitor.
description: The `getChannelList()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a
list of available channels for the site visitor.

examples.title: Get a list of available chat channels
body: // Get channel image of first channel in list
// Get most recent message text of first channel in list

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the chatbox is maximized.

docs.summary: Expands the chatbox and sets its [`maximized`](#maximized) property to `true`.
description: The `maximize()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when
the chatbox finishes expanding.

examples.title: Maximize the chatbox
Maximize the chatbox and log a message when done
Toggle a chatbox's maximized state

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the chatbox is minimized.

docs.summary: Collapses the chatbox and sets its [`maximized`](#maximized) property to `false`.
description: The `minimize()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when
the chatbox finishes collapsing.

examples.title: Minimize the chatbox
Minimize the chatbox and log a message when done
Toggle a chatbox's maximized state

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the chatbox is maximized.

docs.summary: An event that fires when the chatbox is maximized.

examples.title: Register a callback to run after the chatbox is maximized

docs.summary: An event that fires when a site visitor receives a chat message.
description: The `onMessageReceived()` event handler runs when a chat message is received
by a site visitor. The received `Message`
object contains information about the message that was received.

examples.title: Get message data when a chat message is received

notes:
`onMessageReceived()` runs if the message was sent via the chatbox widget. It does not run if the message was sent programatically using [`sendMessage()`](#sendMessage).

 `onMessageReceived()` doesn't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that fires when a site visitor sends a chat message.
description: The `onMessageSent()` event handler runs when a chat message is sent. The sent `Message`
object contains information about the message that was sent.

examples.title: Get message data when a chat message is sent

notes:
`onMessageSent()` runs if the message was sent via the chatbox widget. It does not run if the message was sent programatically using [`sendMessage()`](#sendMessage).

`onMessageSent()` doesn't work when previewing your site.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the chatbox is minimized.

docs.summary: An event that fires when the chatbox is minimized.

examples.title: Register a callback to run after the chatbox is minimized

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element enters the viewport.

ret.doc: The element on which the event is now registered.

docs.summary: Note: This standard element event is not relevant for Chatbox.
description: Adds an event handler that runs when an element is displayed
in the viewable part of the current window.
An element enters the viewport when the page is scrolled to show any
part of the element. An element also enters the viewport if it was
[hidden]($w.HiddenMixin.html#hidden) or [collapsed]($w.CollapsedMixin.html#collapsed)
and is then shown or expanded in the viewable part of the current window. `onViewportEnter()`
is not fired for [hidden]($w.HiddenMixin.html#hidden) or [collapsed]($w.CollapsedMixin.html#collapsed)
elements even if they are scrolled into view.

params.name: handler
params.doc:
The name of the function or
 the function expression to run when the element leaves the viewport.

ret.doc: The element on which the event is now registered.

docs.summary: Note: This standard element event is not relevant for Chatbox.
description: Adds an event handler that runs when an element is no longer
displayed in the viewable part of the current window.
An element leaves the viewport when the page is scrolled so that the
element is completely out of view. An element also leaves the viewport
if it was shown or expanded and is then [hidden]($w.HiddenMixin.html#hidden)
or [collapsed]($w.CollapsedMixin.html#collapsed) from the viewable part
of the current window.  `onViewportLeave()`
is not fired for [hidden]($w.HiddenMixin.html#hidden) or [collapsed]($w.CollapsedMixin.html#collapsed)
elements even if they are scrolled out of view.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the scroll is complete.

docs.summary: Note: This standard element function is not relevant for Chatbox.
description: Scrolls the page to the element using an animation.
The `scrollTo()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the
animated scroll is complete and the element is now in view.
To scroll to a specific location on the page, see the `wix-window`
[`scrollTo()`](wix-window.html#scrollTo) function.
Calling the `scrollTo()` function on an element in a repeated item that
is selected from the [global scope]($w.Repeater.html#global-scope) causes
an error.

params.name: messageInfo
params.doc: An object representing the message to be sent.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the message is sent.

docs.summary: Sends a chat message from a site visitor.
description: The `sendMessage()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when
the message is sent.
Currently only chat messages containing text can be sent programatically.

examples.title: Send a message from a site visitor to the business
Send a message from a site visitor over a specific channel

notes:
Chat messages sent programatically by the `sendMessage()` function do not trigger
 the [`onMessageSent()`](#onMessageSent) event handler.

docs.summary: An object representing a chat channel.

examples.title: Use a channel ID to get information about a specific channel
Get a list of available chat channels
body: // Get channel image of first channel in list
// Get most recent message text of first channel in list

members.name: displayData
members.doc: Display information associated with the channel.

members.name: messages
members.doc: An array of messages sent over the channel. Currently only the last message is included.

docs.summary: An object containing information about a chat channel.
description: The `ChannelInfo` object is used by the [`getChannel()`](#getChannel) and
[`focusChannel()`](#focusChannel) functions to specify which channel to get or focus on.

examples.title: Get information about the channel associated with the specified channel ID
Get information about the currently focused chat channel

members.name: type
members.doc:
Type of chat channel.
 One of the following:

 + `"Focused"`: Currently focused channel.
 + `"Business"`: Business channel.

notes: At least one of the object properties is required. If `channelId` is passed, `type` is ignored.

docs.summary: An object representing display information associated with a [`Channel`](#channel).
description: The data a site visitor sees in the chatbox. The data depends on the current channel type:
<table style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
Channel Type
Description
Display Data
</tr>
<tr>
Business channel
Connects the current user with the site's business
Display data of the business
</tr>
<tr>
Private social channel
Connects the current user with one other member
Display data of the other member
</tr>
<tr>
Group social channel
Connects the current user with other members in a chat group
Display data of the chat group
</tr>

examples.title: Get display data about a specific channel

members.name: image
members.doc:
The image associated with the channel.
 One of the following:

 + For private social channels, the image associated with the site member's account. If there is no image associated with the account, defaults to the avatar image.
 + For group social channels, the image associated with the chat group.
 + For business channels, `image` is not currently supported.

members.name: name
members.doc: For social channels, the member's name or chat group name. For business channels, the site's [display name](wix-site-backend.generalInfo.html#getSiteDisplayName).

members.name: initials
members.doc: Only supported for business channels. Initials of the site's business.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a chat message.

examples.title: Get the channel ID and message text when a chat message is sent
Get the channel ID and message text when a chat message is received

members.name: channelId
members.doc: ID of the channel on which the message was sent.

members.name: type
members.doc: Type of message. Currently only `TEXT` is supported.

members.name: summary
members.doc: First 250 characters of the chat message. Currently only text is included in the summary.

members.name: participantId
members.doc: The sender's member ID. For a message sent from the site's business, the site owner's member ID.

members.name: createdAt
members.doc: Date and time the message was sent.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: An object representing additional contextual message information included in a chat message. Only relevant for messages sent using the backend [`sendMessage()`](wix-chat-backend.html#sendMessage) function. Site visitors do not see metadata.

docs.summary: An object representing a chat message to be sent.

examples.title: Send a message from a site visitor to the site's business
Send a message from a site visitor over a specific channel

members.name: messageText
members.doc: The text to be sent in the message.

members.name: channelId
members.doc: The ID of the channel over which the message is sent. If empty, message is sent to the site's business.

docs.summary: The content of a chat message.
description: Currently only content of type text is included in the `MessagePayload` object.

examples.title: Get the channel ID and message text when a chat message is sent

notes:
You cannot use a channel programmatically until it is created. A channel is created the first
 time the business or a visitor sends a message via the chatbox widget to a specific recipient.

 You can also send chat messages from the [backend](wix-chat-backend.html) of your site.
